question: Where did the Prince live?
answer1: in a grand Castle

question: What did the Prince realize when he looked at the shoe?
answer1: a dainty little lady she would need to be who wore such a very small shoe

question: What did the Prince decide to do?
answer1: never marry until he found a maiden who could wear the shoe, and that, when he found her, he would ask her to be his wife

question: What did the Prince do after he decided his plan?
answer1: called all his Lords and Courtiers to him, and told them of the determination that he had come to, and asked them to help him in his quest

question: What did Lords, Courtiers, and the Prince do after they had taken council together?
answer1: summoned a trusty Knight, and appointed him the Prince's Ambassador; and told him to take the slipper, and mount a fleet-footed horse, and ride up and down the whole of the Kingdom until he found a lady whom it would fit

question: Why did all the ladies flock to wherever the Ambassador stayed at?
answer1: Whoever could wear it should be the Prince's Bride.

question: What did the Ambassador do at every town and castle?
answer1: summoned all the ladies to appear before him to try on the shoe

question: How did the ladies feel when they did not fit the shoe?
answer1: disappointed

question: Where did the Ambassador arrive at last?
answer1: at a house where a well-to-do Laird had lived

question: Who had grown poor of late, and who had to work hard for their living?
answer1: his wife and two daughters

question: Who wanted to try on the shoe?
answer1: the elder sister

question: Why didn't the younger sister want to try on the shoe?
answer1: She believed she was not fit for the position as the wife of a great Prince.
answer2: She believed she could not do anything as the wife of a great Prince.

question: What did the younger girl do when the Ambassador asked if she wanted to try on the shoe?
answer1: shook her head and went on with her work

question: How did the elder sister trick the Ambassador that the shoe fit?
answer1: She clipped part of her toes.

question: How did the younger sister know that the shoe did not fit her elder sister?
answer1: Her face was very white, and that she walked with a little limp.

question: How did everyone feel when the shoe fit on the elder sister?
answer1: surprised

question: What did the younger sister do when she noticed that the shoe did not fit her elder sister?
answer1: shook her wise little head, and said nothing

question: How will the Ambassador feel when he finds a girl who fits the shoe?
answer1: delighted

question: Why did the ladies cry when the shoe did not fit them?
answer1: prided themselves on the smallness of their feet, and who had set out full of lively expectation that they would be the successful competitors

question: Why were the ladies disappointed?
answer1: Not one of them could make her foot small enough to go into the Fairy Shoe.

question: What did the Ambassador do when he had found a wife for his master?
answer1: mounted his horse and rode off at full speed to tell him the good news

question: What did the Prince order his Courtiers to do when he heard of the success of the Ambassador's errand?
answer1: accompany him next day when he went to bring home his Bride

question: What did the younger sister do before the Prince arrived?
answer1: went and hid herself behind a great pot which stood in the corner of the courtyard, and which was used for boiling hen's meat

question: What did the old mother and the plain-looking maid-of-all-work do before the Prince arrived?
answer1: ran hither and thither, fetching such meat and drink as the house could boast to set before their high-born visitors

question: Why did the younger sister hide from the Prince?
answer1: She did not want to reveal she had the smallest foot in the house.
answer2: She was worried the Prince would make her try the slipper.

question: Why was the elder sister selfish?
answer1: The selfish elder sister did not help at all, but ran up  her chamber, and decked herself out in all the fine clothes that she possessed before she came downstairs to meet the Prince.

question: Why did the elder sister forget to say good-bye to her mother and sister?
answer1: She rode off so full of her own importance.

question: Who told the truth about what the elder sister did to make the shoe fit?
answer1: a little bird

question: Why did the Prince want to find the younger sister?
answer1: The bird sang the truth.

question: What did the elder sister do to make the shoe fit?
answer1: She nipped and clipped her foot.
answer2: She removed part of her foot.

question: How did the Prince know where to find his true wife?
answer1: The bird said she was hiding near a caldron.
answer2: The bird revealed where the younger sister was hiding.

question: What did the Prince do when he reached the Laird's house?
answer1: ordered a search to be made in the courtyard

question: What happened to the younger sister when the whole party turned back to search for her?
answer1: The bonnie little sister was soon discovered and brought out, all blushes and confusion, from her hiding-place behind the caldron.

question: How did everyone know that the elder sister clipped off the tops of her toes to get the shoe on?
answer1: The Prince ordered her to take off her shoe.
answer2: The elder sister needed to give the shoe to her sister.

question: How did the younger sister feel when she was brought out from her hiding-place?
answer1: confused

question: How did the bystanders feel when they saw the elder sister's foot?
answer1: horrified

question: What happened after the younger sister put the shoe on?
answer1: It fitted her little sister's foot exactly.

question: What did the Prince do after he saw that the shoe fit the younger sister?
answer1: lifted the elder sister down from his horse and lifted the little one up in her place, and carried her home to his Palace

question: What did the Prince and younger sister do when they reached the palace?
answer1: They got married.
